subject: Public Speaking
title: Rhetorical Questions That Shift Thinking
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rhetorical Questions That Shift Thinking usable.

hook.text: If not now, when? If not us, who? You're not expected to answer. But your brain answers anyway.

buildup.text: Rhetorical questions work because they force the audience to internally generate the answer you want.

discovery.text: Self-generated conclusions are more persuasive than ones you're told. You believe what you think first.

twist.text: The trick: the question must have an obvious answer. If the audience disagrees with your implied answer, it backfires.

climax.text: A well-placed rhetorical question turns passive listeners into active participants. They persuade themselves.

punchline.text: Don't tell them the answer. Make them think it.

quiz.question: Why are rhetorical questions persuasive?
options: They force listeners to internally generate the desired answer
